name: JSON
description: The JSON DAT converts and filters JSON text using JSONPath syntax and outputs the filtered results. It eliminates having to code scripts to parse and manipulate JSON, and keeps the data flow procedural.
summary: The JSON DAT converts and filters JSON text using JSONPath syntax and outputs the filtered results. It eliminates having to code scripts to parse and manipulate JSON, and keeps the data flow procedura

parameters.name: Filter
parameters.label: Filter
parameters.description:
From Derivative
		
		
		
		
		Jump to navigation
		Jump to search
		
The JSON  converts and filters JSON text using JSONPath syntax and outputs the filtered results. It eliminates having to code scripts to parse and manipulate JSON, and keeps the data flow procedural.
It expects JSON text as input and converts the input to a Python object in the .source member.
It then filters the JSON down using the JSONPath Filter parameter, and it outputs the resulting data from the  as JSON text. 
It also puts the filtered results as .results (a Python list of results) and .result (the first result).
You can test expressions on .source, .result and .results by setting the Output menu to  and using expressions like me.result['city'], which outputs the evaluated expression from the . You can then use that expression as op('json1').result['city'] in an expression elsewhere.  .expr is also a member of the JSON , for example, op('json1').expr returns the evaluated expression parameter.
Output tables: The JSON  can output a table by setting the Output Format menu to Table. It will do its best to take the result of the JSON Filter and form rows and columns of values and headings in a  table. Any cell than can't be expressed as a simple string, integer, float or boolean will be left as the JSON string of the remainder. A cell or range of cells can be further reduced with a Select DAT and then passed to another JSON  which can convert the JSON strings to a table.
See also: JSONPath, OP Snippets, and the TDJSON functions for converting and manipulating JSON data.
jsonDAT_Class

Contents
 
 
 
 
 
 
 





  filter - A filter string following JSONPath syntax that will be used to filter the input JSON.



  output -  - Select the output of the JSON .

 filterresult - Outputs list returned from applying the filter to the JSON text input. expression - Output a custom expression.

  expression - The custom expression to output



  formatoutput - When enabled, the output of the  will formatted with indents and newlines.



  holdlast - When enabled, the most recent result will be held if the results become empty, in effect only new non-empty results will update the output.





  language -  - Select how the  decides which script language to operate on.

 input - The  uses the inputs script language. node - The  uses it's own script language.

  extension -  - Select the file extension this  should expose to external editors.

 dat - various common file extensions. frag - glsl - html - md - py - rtf - tsv - txt - vert - xml - languageext - pick extension from DATs script language. customext - Specify a custom extension.

  customext - Specifiy the custom extension.



  wordwrap -  - Enable Word Wrap for Node Display.

 input - The  uses the inputs setting. on - Turn on Word Wrap. off - Turn off Word Wrap.



 - A JSON text input.


Extra Information for the JSON  can be accessed via an Info CHOP.



 - Number of rows in this . - Number of columns in this .
 - Number of times the operator has cooked since the process started. - Duration of the last cook in milliseconds. - Frame number when this operator was last cooked relative to the component timeline. - Frame number when this operator was last cooked relative to the absolute time. - Time in milliseconds at which the operator started cooking in the frame it was cooked. - Time in milliseconds at which the operator finished cooking in the frame it was cooked. - 1 if operator was cooked this frame. - Number of warnings in this operator if any. - Number of errors in this operator if any.
TouchDesigner Build: Latest\n2021.10000before 2021.10000
DATs
• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • 

An Operator Family that manipulates text strings: multi-line text or tables. Multi-line text is often a python Script or GLSL Shader, but can be any multi-line text. Tables are rows and columns of cells, each containing a text string.



A text string that contains data (string, float, list, boolean, etc.) and operators (+ * < etc) that are evaluated by the node's language (python or Tscript) and returns a string, float list or boolean, etc. Expressions are used in parameters, DATs and in scripts.



Operators that need 1 or more inputs are called Filters in TouchDesigner, like a Math CHOP. See Generator.



The generic thing that holds an Operator, and includes Flags (display, bypass, lock, render, immune) and its position/size in the network. Whether you "lay down an Operator" or "lay down an Node", you're doing the same thing.



An Operator Family which operate on Channels (a sequence of numbers (Samples)) which are used for animation, audio, mathematics, simulation, logic, UI construction, and data streamed from/to devices and protocols.








Retrieved from "https://docs.derivative.ca/index.php?title=JSON_DAT&oldid=27875"
		Category: DATs
